tool.name: MapAlignerTreeGuided
tool.description: Tree guided correction of retention time distortions between maps.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in_cond.in && #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else ln -s '$in_cond.in' 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' && #end if #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out && mkdir ${' '.join(["'out/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && #end if #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir trafo_out && mkdir ${' '.join(["'trafo_out/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' #end if #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out ${' '.join(["'out/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext("featurexml")) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -trafo_out ${' '.join(["'trafo_out/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') ${' '.join(["&& mv -n 'out/%(bn)s/%(id)s.%(gext)s' 'out/%(bn)s/%(id)s'"%{"bn": i, "id": re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), "gext": $gxy2omsext("featurexml")} for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if "trafo_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') ${' '.join(["&& mv -n 'trafo_out/%(bn)s/%(id)s.%(gext)s' 'trafo_out/%(bn)s/%(id)s'"%{"bn": i, "id": re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), "gext": $gxy2omsext("trafoxml")} for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in_select
param.label: Run tool in batch mode for -in
param.option: Yes: process each dataset in an independent job

param.label: Input files to align (all must have the same file type)
Input files to align (all must have the same file type)

param.name: model_type
param.label: Options to control the modeling of retention time transformations from data

param.name: type
param.label: Type of model

param.name: symmetric_regression
param.label: Perform linear regression on 'y - x' vs

param.name: x_weight
param.label: Weight x values

param.name: y_weight
param.label: Weight y values

param.name: x_datum_min
param.label: Minimum x value

param.name: x_datum_max
param.label: Maximum x value

param.name: y_datum_min
param.label: Minimum y value

param.name: y_datum_max
param.label: Maximum y value

param.name: wavelength
param.label: Determines the amount of smoothing by setting the number of nodes for the B-spline
param.help: The number is chosen so that the spline approximates a low-pass filter with this cutoff wavelength. The wavelength is given in the same units as the data; a higher value means more smoothing. '0' sets the number of nodes to twice the number of input points

param.name: num_nodes
param.label: Number of nodes for B-spline fitting
param.help: Overrides 'wavelength' if set (to two or greater). A lower value means more smoothing

param.name: extrapolate
param.label: Method to use for extrapolation beyond the original data range
param.help: 'linear': Linear extrapolation using the slope of the B-spline at the corresponding endpoint. 'b_spline': Use the B-spline (as for interpolation). 'constant': Use the constant value of the B-spline at the corresponding endpoint. 'global_linear': Use a linear fit through the data (which will most probably introduce discontinuities at the ends of the data range)

param.name: boundary_condition
param.label: Boundary condition at B-spline endpoints: 0 (value zero), 1 (first derivative zero) or 2 (second derivative zero)

param.name: span
param.label: Fraction of datapoints (f) to use for each local regression (determines the amount of smoothing)
param.help: Choosing this parameter in the range .2 to .8 usually results in a good fit

param.name: num_iterations
param.label: Number of robustifying iterations for lowess fitting

param.name: delta
param.label: Nonnegative parameter which may be used to save computations (recommended value is 0.01 of the range of the input
param.help: e.g. for data ranging from 1000 seconds to 2000 seconds, it could be set to 10). Setting a negative value will automatically do this

param.name: interpolation_type
param.label: Method to use for interpolation between datapoints computed by lowess
param.help: 'linear': Linear interpolation. 'cspline': Use the cubic spline for interpolation. 'akima': Use an akima spline for interpolation

param.name: extrapolation_type
param.label: Method to use for extrapolation outside the data range
param.help: 'two-point-linear': Uses a line through the first and last point to extrapolate. 'four-point-linear': Uses a line through the first and second point to extrapolate in front and and a line through the last and second-to-last point in the end. 'global-linear': Uses a linear regression to fit a line through all data points and use it for interpolation

param.name: interpolation_type
param.label: Type of interpolation to apply

param.name: extrapolation_type
param.label: Type of extrapolation to apply: two-point-linear: use the first and last data point to build a single linear model, four-point-linear: build two linear models on both ends using the first two / last two points, global-linear: use all points to build a single linear model
param.help: Note that global-linear may not be continuous at the border

param.name: score_type
param.label: Name of the score type to use for ranking and filtering (.oms input only)
param.help: If left empty, a score type is picked automatically

param.name: score_cutoff
param.label: Use only IDs above a score cut-off (parameter 'min_score') for alignment?

param.name: min_score
param.label: If 'score_cutoff' is 'true': Minimum score for an ID to be considered
param.help: Unless you have very few runs or identifications, increase this value to focus on more informative peptides

param.name: min_run_occur
param.label: Minimum number of runs (incl
param.help: reference, if any) in which a peptide must occur to be used for the alignment.. Unless you have very few runs or identifications, increase this value to focus on more informative peptides

param.name: max_rt_shift
param.label: Maximum realistic RT difference for a peptide (median per run vs
param.help: reference). Peptides with higher shifts (outliers) are not used to compute the alignment.. If 0, no limit (disable filter); if > 1, the final value in seconds; if <= 1, taken as a fraction of the range of the reference RT scale

param.name: use_unassigned_peptides
param.label: Should unassigned peptide identifications be used when computing an alignment of feature or consensus maps
param.help: If 'false', only peptide IDs assigned to features will be used

param.name: use_feature_rt
param.label: When aligning feature or consensus maps, don't use the retention time of a peptide identification directly; instead, use the retention time of the centroid of the feature (apex of the elution profile) that the peptide was matched to
param.help: If different identifications are matched to one feature, only the peptide closest to the centroid in RT is used.. Precludes 'use_unassigned_peptides'

param.name: use_adducts
param.label: If IDs contain adducts, treat differently adducted variants of the same molecule as different
Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

collection.name: out
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out
collection.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

collection.name: trafo_out
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: trafo_out
collection.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "trafo_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Tree guided correction of retention time distortions between maps.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.8.0/html/TOPP_MapAlignerTreeGuided.html
